content: this is a raglan sleeve sweater cropped knitted from the top-down in one piece a basic design with a mesh stitch if you have some previous experience knitting sweaters you can easily change the size due to the type of construction and adjust the measurements to your needs you just have to keep in mind that these changes will modify the amount of material needed **garment measurements** neck circumference 65cm/25 ½ in 72cm/28in chest/waist circumference 98cm/38 ½ in 112cm/44in armhole/wrist circumference 31cm/12in 41cm/16in back/front length from the neck 31cm/12in 42cm/16 ½ in sleeve length from the neck 59cm/23in 66cm/26in raglan length from the neck 20cm/8in 28cm/11in **needles and notions** -6mm circular needles 60 cm / 24 in -optional 6mm double pointed needles one set for the sleeves or use magic loop method if you prefer -different stitch markers 1 stitch marker for the beginning of round 3 stitch markers for the raglan increases -waste yarn for hold the sleeves stitches -tapestry needle -scissors -measuring tape **yarn** caricia nature sport 100% recycled cotton 100g / 150m two three balls sample color 107 *note about the weight of the yarn although it says that it has 8wpi aran i have measured it and i get 10wpi worsted/dk *
